findings.title: C1: Possibility to manipulate a voting process while using the fixed-weights addin
findings.description: Data validation issue allowing manipulation of voting process with fixed-weights addin

findings.title: C2: When using the addin-vesting (for realm), the first user will be able to decide on any proposal after his deposit
findings.description: The first user will be able to decide on any proposal after his deposit when using the add-in vesting for realm.

findings.title: M1: Possibility to decide on a proposal without a sufficient voting weight
findings.description: If there are still some active proposals when switching from fixed-weight-addin to vesting-addin, these proposals may become successful due to the addin switch.

findings.title: M2: Possibility of a DoS attack that prevents the creation of a valid maintenance record
findings.description: The issue allows an attacker to perform a DoS attack preventing the creation of a valid maintenance record.

findings.title: L1: Using find_program_address instead of create_program_address
findings.description: Using find_program_address function risks exceeding instruction compute budget due to variable amount of time taken to succeed across different inputs.

findings.title: I1: Unused account
findings.description: The Deposit instruction accepts the governance_program account as input but never calls any instruction of this program, making it unnecessary and increasing transaction size.

findings.title: I2: Misleading docs
findings.description: Misleading documentation inside the maintenance program.

findings.title: I3: Hanging accounts
findings.description: There is no way to close VoterWeightRecord accounts and redeem fees from them, resulting in unused accounts on the chain.
